    Same as CXType.is(CXType, TypeEnvironment), except with the ability to determine whether to use strict boolean equality TypeEnvironment.isStrict(CXType, CXType) is preferred, as it properly unwraps types that need to be unwrapped
    boolean isPrimitive()
    Used as a shortcut for checking if a type is primitive (ie: a non-compound C type) Primitive Types: CXPrimitiveType ShortPrimitive LongPrimitive UnsignedPrimitive PointerType ArrayType
    boolean isValid​(TypeEnvironment e)
    Gets whether a type is valid under a certain type environment A type is valid if it's a correctly formed Primitive, a typedef/alias of a valid type or if the type is a compound type, all of it's members are valid

    • is

      public boolean is​(CXType other, TypeEnvironment e, boolean strictPrimitiveEquality)
      Description copied from class: CXType
      Same as CXType.is(CXType, TypeEnvironment), except with the ability to determine whether to use strict boolean equality TypeEnvironment.isStrict(CXType, CXType) is preferred, as it properly unwraps types that need to be unwrapped
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      other - the other type
      e - the type environment to check in
      strictPrimitiveEquality - Uses a more strict type check for primitives CXPrimitiveType.is(CXType, TypeEnvironment, boolean)
      Returns:
      where this object type "strictly is" another type

      public boolean isValid​(TypeEnvironment e)
      Description copied from class: CXType
      Gets whether a type is valid under a certain type environment A type is valid if it's a correctly formed Primitive, a typedef/alias of a valid type or if the type is a compound type, all of it's members are valid
